content: https://github.com/leanprover-contrib/update-versions-action hasn't been updated in a year and a half. As a result, it is not compatible with Lean 4. For context, it contains the action that provided the <version number> branches in mathlib. @Rob Lewis, should we resuscitate it?
Nope. This was for the leanprover-contrib compatibility checking that is unmaintained and outdated.
Is the plan for Reservoir to take over this version managing?
These branches were also used by leanproject to allow upgrading dependencies without upgrading the lean version itself.
lake still does this, but instead of picking a version of the library compatible with the current lean, it just picks an incompatible version without upgrading Lean!
Ah great :upside_down:
